snippet.title: Best video game consoles
snippet.description: The "next-generation" game consoles are here -- but until their game library hits critical mass, the

snippet.title: With kids, the future of 'Star Wars' is rosy
snippet.description: Road Trip 2010: CNET reporter Daniel Terdiman figured kids were getting hooked on George Lucas' sci-fi universe through video games and books, but it seems the 'Star Wars' movies are still dominant.

snippet.title: Nintendo 2DS
snippet.description: At $130, the 2DS offers a huge array of compelling software and makes for a great entry-level gaming system to the uninitiated first-time gamer. Just be sure to buy a protective case along with it, too.

snippet.title: Nikon D5200
snippet.description: The Nikon D5200 makes a great choice for family and vacation photographers.

snippet.title: Paper and the craft of securing Facebook's future
snippet.description: With the new app for reading and writing the news, the social network sets a different tone for what's to come in the next decade.

snippet.title: Designers craft fashion furniture from Lenovo tabletop PCs
snippet.description: Lenovo commissions designers to take the Horizon tabletop PC and embed it into welcoming and functional furniture.

snippet.title: An afternoon with the Jaguar C-X75
snippet.description: The stunning Jaguar C-X75 will never be made, so an afternoon with four of the five prototype cars produced won't be one we forget in a hurry.

snippet.title: Wampa-head wall trophy shows off Jedi craft skills
snippet.description: Crafty "Star Wars" geeks build a frightening wall-mounted wampa head for $20. Making it doesn't even require traveling to Hoth and dismembering a big toothy animal.

snippet.title: Rainy day? Play these games
snippet.description: Tired of working and doing the same old? Well, check out these online games that will make the day go by.

snippet.title: Parents prefer phones to kids?
snippet.description: Those who specialize in child development say they're noticing more incidents of parents ignoring their kids in favor of their phones. For some kids, phones become hate objects.
